column4: openssh-server and client are installed. Process is available too.
I just get connection refused. I connect over LAN
I do not see my firewall (as I assume I have to customize it) as am unable to find the gui in gnome menu
I get this error: ssh: connect to host 192.168.0.120 port 22: Connection refused
I am sure it has to do with firewall.
ALL I HAVE TO DO is stop firewall service for first time. How to do so? /etc/init.d/ ??
Is your ssh server running, on server: sudo netstat -tulp
I do not have in /etc/init.d iptables
1. on server: sudo netstat -tulp (to see if ssh server works), 2. sudo service iptables stop
I do /etc/init.d/<WHAT DO i WRINTE HERE?>
THEN (on server): sudo netstat -tulp (to see if ssh is listing on port 22 and what ip, should be: *:22)
